title: How to Get Tickets to Beyoncé’s 2025 “COWBOY CARTER” Tour
description: The 22-date run sees Queen Bey headlining stadiums across the US as well as in London and Paris. Learn how to get pre-sale tickets here. How to Get Tickets to Beyoncé’s 2025 “COWBOY CARTER” Tour Paolo Ragusa
author: Paolo Ragusa
excerpt: Beyoncé has announced the 2025 "COWBOY CARTER" stadium tour in support of her Grammy-winning album. Learn how to get pre-sale tickets here.
text: Beyoncé has mapped out a major world tour in support of her Grammy-winning country album, COWBOY CARTER. The 22-date run will be Bey’s first outing since her 2023 “Renaissance World Tour” and will see the superstar playing stadiums throughout the US as well as stints in London and Paris. Find more details below, including how to get tickets, as well as the full list of Beyoncé’s tour dates, pre-sale information, and other details. Get Beyoncé Tickets Here Tickets for Beyoncé’s 2025 “COWBOY CARTER” tour will be available first through various pre-sales. A BeyHive fan club pre-sale begins on February 11th at 12:00 p.m. local time. An artist pre-sale will follow on February 13th at 12:00 p.m. local time (registration is now ongoing through February 6th). In the US, there will also be exclusive pre-sales for Citi and Verizon Up customers beginning February 12th at 12:00 p.m. local time. Tickets will go on sale to the general public beginning Friday, February 14th at 12:00 p.m. local time via Ticketmaster. Once tickets are on sale, fans can also look for deals or get tickets to sold-out dates via StubHub, where your purchase is 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s Fan Protect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand. What Is Beyoncé’s “COWBOY CARTER” Tour? The 2025 “COWBOY CARTER” tour serves as Beyoncé’s seventh solo headlining tour and arrives in support of her expansive 2024 album, COWBOY CARTER. The outing begins with a quartet of opening shows at Los Angeles’ SoFi Stadium from April 28th to May 7th. She’ll continue with a pair of shows in Chicago and four shows in East Rutherford, New Jersey throughout the month of May before heading across the pond for four London shows beginning on June 5th. After two dates in Paris in late June, Bey will make her way back stateside for two shows in Houston followed by two performances in Washington D.C. on July 4th and 7th. The tour will end with a pair of concerts in Atlanta on July 10th and 11th. See Beyoncé’s full list of tour dates below. Though the album was released back in March, Bey held off on live shows until her hometown NFL Halftime Performance at the Houston Texans vs. Baltimore Ravens game on Christmas Day. There, she debuted several tracks from COWBOY CARTER for the first time and teased an announcement for January 14th. However, the 2025 wildfires in Los Angeles forced her to postpone the announcement to Saturday, February 1st, when she then confirmed the tour. She provided details and tour dates for the “COWBOY CARTER” run just hours after winning her first-ever Album of the Year award at the 2025 Grammys; Bey also won Country Album of the Year for COWBOY CARTER, making her the first Black artist to ever win in the category. Meanwhile, we were also big fans of COWBOY CARTER, naming it one of the best albums of 2024. Who Is Opening for Beyoncé on Her “COWBOY CARTER” Tour? No openers have been listed yet for Beyoncé’s “COWBOY CARTER” run, but we’ll update this post as soon as she announces support acts. What Is the Setlist for Beyoncé’s “COWBOY CARTER” Tour? The tour hasn’t properly began yet, so Bey’s setlist for the tour is still unknown. However, she debuted “16 CARRIAGES,” “BLACKBIIRD,” “YA YA,” “My House,” “JOLENE,” “LEVII’S JEANS,” and “TEXAS HOLD ‘EM” at her Christmas Day NFL Halftime Show performance, along with a medley of COWBOY CARTER tracks “SPAGHETTII,” “RIIVERDANCE,” and “SWEET ★ HONEY ★ BUCKIIN'” with Shaboozey. Her “Renaissance World Tour” featured almost the entirety of RENAISSANCE on the setlist each night, but she still peppered in beloved older tracks like “Crazy in Love,” “Love on Top,” “I Care,” “Partition,” “Drunk in Love,” “Diva,” and “Formation.” What Are Beyoncé’s 2025 Tour Dates? See Beyoncé’s full list of 2025 tour dates below, and get tickets here. 04/28 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium 05/01 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium 05/04 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium 05/07 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium 05/15 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field 05/17 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field 05/22 – East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium 05/24 – East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium 05/25 – East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium 05/28 – East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium 06/05 – London, UK @ Tottenham Hotspur Stadium 06/07 – London, UK @ Tottenham Hotspur Stadium 06/10 – London, UK @ Tottenham Hotspur Stadium 06/12 – London, UK @ Tottenham Hotspur Stadium 06/19 – Paris, France @ Stade de France 06/21 – Paris, France @ Stade de France 06/28 – Houston, TX @ NRG Stadium 06/29 – Houston, TX @ NRG Stadium 07/04 – Washington, D.C. @ Northwest Stadium 07/07 – Washington, D.C. @ Northwest Stadium 07/10 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes Benz Stadium 07/11 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes Benz Stadium
html:
Beyoncé has mapped out a major world tour in support of her Grammy-winning country album, COWBOY CARTER. The 22-date run will be Bey’s first outing since her 2023 “Renaissance World Tour” and will see the superstar playing stadiums throughout the US as well as stints in London and Paris.

Find more details below, including how to get tickets, as well as the full list of Beyoncé’s tour dates, pre-sale information, and other details.

Get Beyoncé Tickets Here

Tickets for Beyoncé’s 2025 “COWBOY CARTER” tour will be available first through various pre-sales. A BeyHive fan club pre-sale begins on February 11th at 12:00 p.m. local time. An artist pre-sale will follow on February 13th at 12:00 p.m. local time (registration is now ongoing through February 6th). In the US, there will also be exclusive pre-sales for Citi and Verizon Up customers beginning February 12th at 12:00 p.m. local time.

Tickets will go on sale to the general public beginning Friday, February 14th at 12:00 p.m. local time via Ticketmaster.

Once tickets are on sale, fans can also look for deals or get tickets to sold-out dates via StubHub, where your purchase is 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s Fan Protect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand.

What Is Beyoncé’s “COWBOY CARTER” Tour?

The 2025 “COWBOY CARTER” tour serves as Beyoncé’s seventh solo headlining tour and arrives in support of her expansive 2024 album, COWBOY CARTER.

The outing begins with a quartet of opening shows at Los Angeles’ SoFi Stadium from April 28th to May 7th. She’ll continue with a pair of shows in Chicago and four shows in East Rutherford, New Jersey throughout the month of May before heading across the pond for four London shows beginning on June 5th. After two dates in Paris in late June, Bey will make her way back stateside for two shows in Houston followed by two performances in Washington D.C. on July 4th and 7th. The tour will end with a pair of concerts in Atlanta on July 10th and 11th. See Beyoncé’s full list of tour dates below.

Though the album was released back in March, Bey held off on live shows until her hometown NFL Halftime Performance at the Houston Texans vs. Baltimore Ravens game on Christmas Day. There, she debuted several tracks from COWBOY CARTER for the first time and teased an announcement for January 14th. However, the 2025 wildfires in Los Angeles forced her to postpone the announcement to Saturday, February 1st, when she then confirmed the tour.

She provided details and tour dates for the “COWBOY CARTER” run just hours after winning her first-ever Album of the Year award at the 2025 Grammys; Bey also won Country Album of the Year for COWBOY CARTER, making her the first Black artist to ever win in the category.

Meanwhile, we were also big fans of COWBOY CARTER, naming it one of the best albums of 2024.

Who Is Opening for Beyoncé on Her “COWBOY CARTER” Tour?

No openers have been listed yet for Beyoncé’s “COWBOY CARTER” run, but we’ll update this post as soon as she announces support acts.

What Is the Setlist for Beyoncé’s “COWBOY CARTER” Tour?

The tour hasn’t properly began yet, so Bey’s setlist for the tour is still unknown. However, she debuted “16 CARRIAGES,” “BLACKBIIRD,” “YA YA,” “My House,” “JOLENE,” “LEVII’S JEANS,” and “TEXAS HOLD ‘EM” at her Christmas Day NFL Halftime Show performance, along with a medley of COWBOY CARTER tracks “SPAGHETTII,” “RIIVERDANCE,” and “SWEET ★ HONEY ★ BUCKIIN'” with Shaboozey.

Her “Renaissance World Tour” featured almost the entirety of RENAISSANCE on the setlist each night, but she still peppered in beloved older tracks like “Crazy in Love,” “Love on Top,” “I Care,” “Partition,” “Drunk in Love,” “Diva,” and “Formation.”

What Are Beyoncé’s 2025 Tour Dates?

See Beyoncé’s full list of 2025 tour dates below, and get tickets here.

04/28 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium

05/28 – East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium

07/11 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes Benz Stadium
